dcterms:creator: L. P. Kaelbling
M. L. Littman
A. R. Cassandra
dcterms:description: The Factored Tiger problem is an extension of the well-known Tiger problem, where the agent must choose between two doors, one hiding a tiger and the other a reward. The state space is artificially increased by adding uninformative binary state features.
dcterms:title: Factored Tiger

dcterms:creator: Y. Luo
H. Bai
D. Hsu
W. S. Lee
dcterms:description: The Collision Avoidance problem involves an agent piloting a plane in a grid while avoiding a vertically moving obstacle. The agent must navigate while observing the obstacle's location with noise.
dcterms:title: Collision Avoidance

dcterms:description: Gridworld is a 2-dimensional grid where the agent must navigate to a goal cell while observing its own location with noise. The agent can move in all four directions and must avoid trap cells that decrease the chance of success.
dcterms:title: Gridworld

dcterms:creator: L. P. Kaelbling
M. L. Littman
A. R. Cassandra
dcterms:description: The Tiger problem involves an agent deciding whether to open one of two doors, one hiding a tiger and the other a reward. The agent can listen for a signal that provides noisy information about the tiger's location.
dcterms:title: Tiger problem
